channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Target Semantics Clustering via Text Representations for Robust Universal Domain Adaptation
item.description: Universal Domain Adaptation (UniDA) focuses on transferring source domain knowledge to the target domain under both domain shift and unknown category shift.

item.title: BodyGen: Advancing Towards Efficient Embodiment Co-Design
item.description: Embodiment co-design aims to optimize a robot's morphology and control policy simultaneously.

item.title: What Makes a Good Diffusion Planner for Decision Making?
item.description: Diffusion models have recently shown significant potential in solving decision-making problems, particularly in generating behavior plans -- also known as diffusion planning.

item.title: Retrieval Backward Attention without Additional Training: Enhance Embeddings of Large Language Models via Repetition
item.description: Language models can be viewed as functions that embed text into Euclidean space, where the quality of the embedding vectors directly determines model performance, training such neural networks involves various uncertainties.

item.title: MAMUT: A Novel Framework for Modifying Mathematical Formulas for the Generation of Specialized Datasets for Language Model Training
item.description: Mathematical formulas are a fundamental and widely used component in various scientific fields, serving as a universal language for expressing complex concepts and relationships.

item.title: TomoSelfDEQ: Self-Supervised Deep Equilibrium Learning for Sparse-Angle CT Reconstruction
item.description: Deep learning has emerged as a powerful tool for solving inverse problems in imaging, including computed tomography (CT).

item.title: S4ConvD: Adaptive Scaling and Frequency Adjustment for Energy-Efficient Sensor Networks in Smart Buildings
item.description: Predicting energy consumption in smart buildings is challenging due to dependencies in sensor data and the variability of environmental conditions.

item.title: FedConv: A Learning-on-Model Paradigm for Heterogeneous Federated Clients
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) facilitates collaborative training of a shared global model without exposing clients' private data.

item.title: FRU-Adapter: Frame Recalibration Unit Adapter for Dynamic Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: As a result, the FRU-Adapter captures enhanced temporal dependencies by considering the irrelevant frames in a clip.

item.title: Everything, Everywhere, All at Once: Is Mechanistic Interpretability Identifiable?
item.description: This work contributes to defining explanation standards in AI.

item.title: Integrating convolutional layers and biformer network with forward-forward and backpropagation training
item.description: Accurate molecular property prediction is crucial for drug discovery and computational chemistry, facilitating the identification of promising compounds and accelerating therapeutic development.

item.title: Improved 3D Point-Line Mapping Regression for Camera Relocalization
item.description: To this end, we introduce a new architecture that learns to prioritize each feature independently before combining them for localization.

item.title: UniTok: A Unified Tokenizer for Visual Generation and Understanding
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce UniTok, a discrete visual tokenizer that encodes fine-grained details for generation while also capturing high-level semantics for understanding.

item.title: Exponential Topology-enabled Scalable Communication in Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To fully unlock the potential of exponential graphs as communication topologies, we employ memory-based message processors and auxiliary tasks to ground messages, ensuring that they reflect global information and benefit decision-making.

item.title: Few-Shot Multilingual Open-Domain QA from 5 Examples
item.description: Recent approaches to multilingual open-domain question answering (MLODQA) have achieved promising results given abundant language-specific training data.

item.title: FINEREASON: Evaluating and Improving LLMs' Deliberate Reasoning through Reflective Puzzle Solving
item.description: Building on this, we introduce two tasks: state checking, and state transition, for a comprehensive evaluation of how models assess the current situation and plan the next move.

item.title: Mixtera: A Data Plane for Foundation Model Training
item.description: We build and present Mixtera, a data plane for foundation model training that enables users to declaratively express which data samples should be used in which proportion and in which order during training.

item.title: Collaborative Stance Detection via Small-Large Language Model Consistency Verification
item.description: However, heavily relying on LLMs for stance detection, regardless of the cost, is impractical for real-world social media monitoring systems that require vast data analysis.

item.title: Vision-Encoders (Already) Know What They See: Mitigating Object Hallucination via Simple Fine-Grained CLIPScore
item.description: Recently, Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) show remarkable performance across various domains.

item.title: Sanity Checking Causal Representation Learning on a Simple Real-World System
item.description: We evaluate methods for causal representation learning (CRL) on a simple, real-world system where these methods are expected to work.

item.title: UniDepthV2: Universal Monocular Metric Depth Estimation Made Simpler
item.description: However, the remarkable accuracy of recent MMDE methods is confined to their training domains.

item.title: Sensing and Steering Stereotypes: Extracting and Applying Gender Representation Vectors in LLMs
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are known to perpetuate stereotypes and exhibit biases.

item.title: Towards Collaborative Anti-Money Laundering Among Financial Institutions
item.description: The experimental results demonstrate that our methods can effectively identify cross-institution money laundering subgroups.

item.title: Implicit Search via Discrete Diffusion: A Study on Chess
item.description: Furthermore, DiffuSearch demonstrates a notable 30% enhancement in puzzle-solving abilities compared to explicit search-based policies, along with a significant 540 Elo increase in game-playing strength assessment.

item.title: R2-T2: Re-Routing in Test-Time for Multimodal Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: In large multimodal models (LMMs), the perception of non-language modalities (e. g., visual representations) is usually not on par with the large language models (LLMs)' powerful reasoning capabilities, deterring LMMs' performance on challenging downstream tasks.

item.title: Your contrastive learning problem is secretly a distribution alignment problem
item.description: Despite the success of contrastive learning (CL) in vision and language, its theoretical foundations and mechanisms for building representations remain poorly understood.

item.title: AutoBS: Autonomous Base Station Deployment Framework with Reinforcement Learning and Digital Twin Network
item.description: This paper introduces AutoBS, a reinforcement learning (RL)-based framework for optimal base station (BS) deployment in 6G networks.

item.title: HVI: A New color space for Low-light Image Enhancement
item.description: Low-Light Image Enhancement (LLIE) is a crucial computer vision task that aims to restore detailed visual information from corrupted low-light images.

item.title: SecureGaze: Defending Gaze Estimation Against Backdoor Attacks
item.description: In such attacks, adversaries inject backdoor triggers by poisoning the training data, creating a backdoor vulnerability: the model performs normally with benign inputs, but produces manipulated gaze directions when a specific trigger is present.

item.title: FlexVAR: Flexible Visual Autoregressive Modeling without Residual Prediction
item.description: This work challenges the residual prediction paradigm in visual autoregressive modeling and presents FlexVAR, a new Flexible Visual AutoRegressive image generation paradigm.

item.title: Transfer Learning in Latent Contextual Bandits with Covariate Shift Through Causal Transportability
item.description: We show that naively transferring all knowledge for classical bandit algorithms in this setting led to negative transfer.

item.title: Generative augmentations for improved cardiac ultrasound segmentation using diffusion models
item.description: This work utilizes diffusion models to create generative augmentations that can significantly improve diversity of the dataset and thus the generalisability of segmentation models without the need for more annotated data.

item.title: High-Fidelity Relightable Monocular Portrait Animation with Lighting-Controllable Video Diffusion Model
item.description: We address this limitation by distinguishing these feature types through dedicated subspaces within the feature space of a pre-trained image-to-video diffusion model.

item.title: SegLocNet: Multimodal Localization Network for Autonomous Driving via Bird's-Eye-View Segmentation
item.description: Extensive experiments on the nuScenes and Argoverse datasets demonstrate that our method outperforms the current state-of-the-art methods, and that our method can accurately estimate the ego pose in urban environments without relying on GNSS, while maintaining strong generalization ability.

item.title: CirT: Global Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Forecasting with Geometry-inspired Transformer
item.description: Accurate Subseasonal-to-Seasonal (S2S) climate forecasting is pivotal for decision-making including agriculture planning and disaster preparedness but is known to be challenging due to its chaotic nature.

item.title: Out-of-distribution Generalization for Total Variation based Invariant Risk Minimization
item.description: We find that the autonomous TV penalty hyperparameter is exactly the Lagrangian multiplier.

item.title: Training Robust Graph Neural Networks by Modeling Noise Dependencies
item.description: In real-world applications, node features in graphs often contain noise from various sources, leading to significant performance degradation in GNNs.

item.title: Accurate and Scalable Graph Neural Networks via Message Invariance
item.description: Message passing-based graph neural networks (GNNs) have achieved great success in many real-world applications.

item.title: QPM: Discrete Optimization for Globally Interpretable Image Classification
item.description: QPM represents every class with a binary assignment of very few, typically 5, features, that are also assigned to other classes, ensuring easily comparable contrastive class representations.

item.title: Highly Parallelized Reinforcement Learning Training with Relaxed Assignment Dependencies
item.description: It relaxes assignment dependencies between subtask components and enables event-driven asynchronous communication.

item.title: Learning Classifiers That Induce Markets
item.description: When learning is used to inform decisions about humans, such as for loans, hiring, or admissions, this can incentivize users to strategically modify their features to obtain positive predictions.

item.title: The erasure of intensive livestock farming in text-to-image generative AI
item.description: While OpenAI introduced prompt revision to mitigate bias, in the case of farmed animal production systems, it paradoxically introduces a strong bias towards unrealistic farming practices.

item.title: A2-GNN: Angle-Annular GNN for Visual Descriptor-free Camera Relocalization
item.description: Visual localization involves estimating the 6-degree-of-freedom (6-DoF) camera pose within a known scene.

item.title: Towards Responsible AI in Education: Hybrid Recommendation System for K-12 Students Case Study
item.description: The growth of Educational Technology (EdTech) has enabled highly personalized learning experiences through Artificial Intelligence (AI)-based recommendation systems tailored to each student needs.

item.title: Identifiable Multi-View Causal Discovery Without Non-Gaussianity
item.description: We propose a novel approach to linear causal discovery in the framework of multi-view Structural Equation Models (SEM).

item.title: Can a calibration metric be both testable and actionable?
item.description: Forecast probabilities often serve as critical inputs for binary decision making.

item.title: Large Language Models as Attribution Regularizers for Efficient Model Training
item.description: Specifically, we propose an attribution-matching regularization term that aligns the training dynamics of the smaller model with the insights provided by the LLM.

item.title: Gradient-Guided Annealing for Domain Generalization
item.description: We propose alleviating domain conflicts in model optimization, by iteratively annealing the parameters of a model in the early stages of training and searching for points where gradients align between domains.

item.title: Order-Robust Class Incremental Learning: Graph-Driven Dynamic Similarity Grouping
item.description: In response, we first provide additional theoretical analysis, which reveals that when the similarity among a group of classes is lower, the model demonstrates increased robustness to the class order.

item.title: Dynamic DropConnect: Enhancing Neural Network Robustness through Adaptive Edge Dropping Strategies
item.description: Dropout and DropConnect are well-known techniques that apply a consistent drop rate to randomly deactivate neurons or edges in a neural network layer during training.
